verb.description: Keep away from or stop oneself from doing (something)
examples: avoid excessive exposure to the sun

verb.description: Repudiate, nullify, or render void (a decree or contract).

phrases: a place that Robyn normally avoided like the plague
I avoid business lunches like the plague
I otherwise try and avoid chain eateries like the plague.
Nowadays production companies try to avoid such situations like the plague.
I do believe Mobile phones makes us more productive, which is why I avoid them like the plague.
origin: Late Middle English: from Old French evuider clear out, get rid of, from vuide empty (see void).
